title: New class wizard doesn't get context right for nested classes
description: When attempting to create a new class using the 'New Class' wizard with a .java file open in the editor, the 'Enclosing Type' field is blank. It should default to the current type in the editor.
OB: The 'Enclosing Type' field in the 'New Class' wizard is blank when a .java file is open in the editor.
EB: The 'Enclosing Type' field in the 'New Class' wizard should default to the current type in the editor when a .java file is open in the editor.
SR:
1. Open a .java file in the editor.
2. Click on the 'New Class' button.
3. Check the 'Enclosing Type' field in the 'New Class' wizard.
